title: Update CHANGELOG.md for v0.2.0 release
description:
**As a** user or contributor
**I want** a comprehensive changelog for v0.2.0
**So that** I understand what's new, changed, and fixed

**Context:**
CHANGELOG.md exists but needs updating for v0.2.0 public release. Should follow Keep a Changelog format and document all major features completed across the 7 epics.

Major accomplishments since 0.1.0:
- 70+ tickets completed
- Complete TUI implementation
- CLI commands (ask, chat, history, config)
- Multi-provider AI (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, Ollama)
- Tool calling system (bash, file operations, code search, image analysis)
- Vision/image analysis support
- Comprehensive documentation (70+ doc fixes this session)

**Technical Notes:**
- File: CHANGELOG.md
- Format: Keep a Changelog (https://keepachangelog.com/)
- Sections: Added, Changed, Deprecated, Removed, Fixed, Security
- Reference completed tickets and epics
- Include upgrade notes if breaking changes

**Acceptance Criteria:**

**Given** CHANGELOG.md
**When** I read the v0.2.0 section
**Then** all major features are documented with ticket references

**Given** a user upgrading from 0.1.0
**When** they read the changelog
**Then** they understand what changed and any migration steps needed

**Testing Considerations:**
- Compare against `gira board` to ensure completeness
- Check all epics (EPIC-001 through EPIC-009)
- Verify ticket links work
- Ensure format follows Keep a Changelog standard

**Implementation Hints:**
- Review all done tickets from past month
- Group by epic for organization
- Include CLI examples where relevant
- Add links to documentation for new features

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Successfully created comprehensive CHANGELOG.md for v0.2.0 release.

Added detailed sections covering:
- CLI commands (ask, chat, history, config)
- Complete TUI with conversation management
- Multi-provider AI support (4 providers)
- Tool calling system (6+ tools)
- Image analysis with security features
- Token counting improvements
- 70+ documentation fixes

Includes Changed, Fixed, Security, Performance, Developer Experience, and Upgrade Notes sections.

Total documentation: 144 lines added describing 70+ completed tickets across 7 epics.
